props.xfLabel: What is the source of the discharge and/or pollutants present?
Day After Tomorrow Max Probability of Precipitation
2 Days After Tomorrow Max Probability of Precipitation
Is the project SWPPP and BMP plan up to date, available on-site, and being properly implemented?
Are all stockpiled materials covered and bermed if not being actively used?
Are all construction materials properly stored and inventoried?
Material storage yard is clean and organized with materials stored appropriately?
Are portable toilets and rinse stations cited properly and equipped with secondary containment?
Are trash bins and waste disposal containers covered at the end of each day or prior to rain?
Are washout areas (e.g. concrete) contained and installed appropriately with adequate freeboard?
Are all waste bins, portable toilets, or washouts free of any leaks, spills or washout on the ground?
Are nearby storm drains, ditches, or off-site conveyances free of spills, leaks, or wash water?
Good Housekeeping for Vehicle Storage and Maintenance
Are all construction vehicles stored, fueled, and washed properly, according to permit requirements?
Measures are in place to prevent oil, grease, or fuel from leaking into the ground, storm drains, or surface waters?
Are non-stormwater discharges properly controlled and monitored?
Are wind erosion controls effectively implemented?
Are all inactive areas of soil disturbance properly protected with erosion controls?
Are erosion control BMPs in place for active areas?
Erosion control BMPs are installed properly and not in need of maintenance?
Are appropriate perimeter controls established and effective in controlling erosion and sediment discharges from the site?
Are all entrances and exits stabilized and effective in controlling sediment discharges from the site?
If sediment basins are installed on site, are they designed appropriately and properly maintained?
Storm drain inlets and conveyances are protected with sediment controls with no maintenance needed?
Linear sediment control along toe of slope, face of slope at grade breaks (risk 2 or 3)?
Is run-on to the site effectively managed and directed away from all disturbed areas?
Dewatering activities in progress and compliant with discharge parameters?
